page.title: 02Local News From Otley.
page.content: Otley's market square has been recobbled.The market was moved to a nearby carpark,but has now been transferred to its original location. Following the markets recobbling (costing Â£60,000) a ban has been placed to prevent vehicles parking on the square. A warehouseman has stolen a Â£300 racing bike to ride home on after a nights drinking.Apparently he smashed the window of Chevin Cycles and was found 100 metres down the road,in the gutter,with the Â£300 bike beside him.Otley councillors have agreed to spend Â£700 on a site investigation into the possible uses for the land.The council will buy the land (at Gallows Hill) from the Water Authourities to prevent them from using it for sewage disposal. By Lesley Lake,Jennifer Francis and Jean Howe.
